intro: Xylomelum benthamii, commonly known as the Bentham's xylomelum, is a small evergreen shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. Xylomelum benthamii is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions. It is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
